service.name: File Format Conversion
service.description: The ELRC Repository file format converter extracts the textual content from files in a set of input formats and converts this content in XML.

input.description: A zipped collection of files (UTF-8 txt, UTF-8 HTML, pdf, docx, doc).

output.description: A zip archive with XML files (one for each document in the input collection) compatible with the Corpus Encoding Standard . Each XML file contains a <header> element with metadata. A <body> element contains the content of the document, segmented in paragraphs. This XML representation is used by all other services in this table.

service.name: UTF-8 Conversion
service.description: The ELRC Repository UTF-8 converter detects the encoding of the textual content of a file and converts this content to UTF-8.

input.description: A file (txt, html) to be converted.The encoding of this file. If the encoding is not provided by the user, the input encoding is detected automatically.

output.description: The input file converted to UTF-8.

service.name: Language Identification
service.description: The ELRC Repository language identifier detects the language in a document and its paragraphs.

input.description: A zipped collection of files (UTF-8 txt, UTF-8 HTML, pdf, docx, doc).

service.name: (near) Deduplication
service.description: The ELRC Repository deduplicator examines a directory for (near) duplicate documents and removes them. First, it uses the ELRC Repository language identifier. Then, it detects (near) duplicates based on lists of quantized frequencies of words on document/paragraph level.

input.description: A zipped collection of files (UTF-8 txt, UTF-8 HTML, pdf, docx, doc).

service.name: Pair Detection
service.description: The ELRC Repository pair detector examines documents in a directory with the aim of identifying pairs of documents that could be considered parallel (i.e. pairs of documents that are translations of each other). First, it uses the ELRC Repository deduplicator. Then, it identifies document pairs.

input.description: A zipped collection of files (UTF-8 txt, UTF-8 HTML, pdf, docx, doc).
